text: This has become our go to pizza place. I love there crust and all there specialty pizzas seem to have there own seasoning on the crust (I think I've had all the specialties). There pasta is ok and there zucchini needs more if a crunchy batter but its still ok.  The delivery people are always nice and friendly (I think he prob doesn't even have to gps my house anymore.) and it may take up to an hour sometimes for the pizza to get here but it's always hot and fresh. Had a forgotten soda once but i hot a free one next time. Really good place.

Probably more like 2.5 stars, benefit of the doubt as they are a pizza joint and I ordered wings and pasta.

The wings were excellent, the pasta was as bad as the wings were delicious. 
Chicken Alfredo was pure crap, small amount of dry chicken (arguably that could be the good about it), the noodles were overcooked - mushy - and the "sauce" was almost nonexistent and tasted like cornstarch in water, literally. 
Wings were garlic romano, excellent taste and done perfectly. 
In town on business, will order from here again to try the pizza (and more wings), update rating a star or 2 if pizza is as good as the wings.

*update - another one of the guys from our group tried the pizza, compared it to those "english muffin pizzas you make when you're a broke but stoned college student" .... so while I've never had one of those, I do know that munchies are the beer goggles of food.... won't be ordering from here, and 2 stars remain.

We tried Vocelli's for the first time tonight and found it to be great! The guy who answered the phone spoke clearly, listened well, and our order was correct! We were told 30 - 45 minutes for delivery but our order arrived in about 25 minutes. We ordered the Hunger Buster, large one topping pizza, one hoagie, bread sticks, and a 2 liter of soda. The pizza was hot, as in fresh out of the oven HOT! and the pepperoni topping was just curled and crisped, the hoagie was on a fresh bun and it didn't have a greasy river pouring off it, the bread sticks were exactly that, bread sticks. They took freash dough and baked it till a crust on the outside but still soft on the inside them covered it in garlic butter and parmesan cheese. For $25.00 it was a meal for two days! Will definitely be calling them again!

They truly go out of there way.  I ordered from here several times,  just got a note in the mail from them with a for a free pizza, stating sorry we were late delivering.  I don't even remember them being late.

I order food from this location at least once a week while I am at work.  The people on the phone are very nice.  They are almost always faster than they say they will be and the delivery man I usually get is great.  He always makes sure my order is correct before he leaves the store.  He actually brought me a drink one time even though I didn't order it.  When he gave it to me said don't you usually get a drink?  Big thumbs up to their entire staff.

Kay wanted to come here after our brunch at Our Little Secret Cafe, which sits in the same shopping center as Pat Catan's. And being a guy, at first I groaned, just as I did when she wanted to drag me to Michael's Arts and Crafts.

But just like my Michael's adventure, I became captivated by all of those Toob figurines. Dragons, gorillas, traffic cops! 

Then I saw model cars and planes!

And 2 pound candy canes and gigantic marshmallows, ones that were very real and edible! 

And wind-up toys!

I got lost! Kay had to find me. I didn't want to leave! 

P.S. Humor aside, it's a huge store, and if you're into arts and crafts unlike me, you'll probably walk out with something and find what you're looking for. This particular store does custom framing and has a large art section that includes airbrush supplies.

I love Pat Catans craft stores. I think the selection is much better than at Michael's and other similar stores. 

While this location is on Curry Hollow Road in the plaza near Century 3 that is a little run down, the store itself is large inside and kept up well. It seems neat, clean and staff was friendly towards us. 

Pat Catans is not just a craft store, they have many party planning supplies, games, home decor and much more. The prices are also incredibly reasonable. You also get special discounts with their VIP card.
The workers are always friendly and so helpful. You honestly can't beat the prices anywhere, I can get lost in this store!

Pat Cataan's is a Pittsburgh staple. It was here long before Michael's or Hobby Lobby.  They have everything for crafts under one roof. They also do framing and have lots of home decor. I'm always able to find things there that I can't get at other places. The employees are friendly and helpful.
God bless Pat Catan's. I'm going to be selling things on Etsy soon, and they had everything I needed. Very big store with helpful employees.

Pat Catan's is the ONLY craft store that I shop at unless I am in an absolute pinch. 

The store is huge. Gigantic. I couldn't even fathom a craft store this big until I came here. They have everything you could ever imagine. I know that goes for most craft stores, but Pat Catan's takes it to the next level. I go to craft stores for a variety of reasons, but the number one is for yarn. Pat Catan's has the biggest and (most importantly) cheapest selection of yarn of any craft store I've ever been to. When I go into this store, I know I'm going to find a bunch of yarn that I just absolutely have to have. At other stores, I'm lucky to find anything that I want...and even if I do, it's usually outrageously priced. 

Pat Catan's also has seasonal decorations, custom framing, fake flowers, kids crafts, beading, wood craft supplies, baking and cooking supplies, glass. Basically anything you could imagine. 

They also have an insane amount of cash registers for a craft store that are all almost always open. Seriously they usually have more registers open than Target does. 

One star off because it's hard to navigate, messy, dingy, and comes off as unclean.

I believe this store was more depressing than any Wal-Mart. 

And to make it even lousier, there was a Little Caesar's franchise inside. Hell, I used to like their old-fashioned snack bar. 

I remember buying many an action figure here as a child. *sniff*

Came here today to buy some diet Pepsi 12 pack that was on sale (ad started today). Arrived about 1:00 pm and when I found the Pepsi isle and they where totally out of diet Pepsi and there were no signs saying that Pepsi was on sale ( like I said today is the first day of the sale. How can a store be out of a product on the first day of a sale? This was not the  first time this has happened.

I had no idea this Kmart existed. It is certainly bigger and busier than the ones I've been to at Edgewood and Monroeville. It has a pharmacy as well as a Kmart cafe and a Little Caesars inside. Shelves are well stocked and the store is clean overall.
I like this Kmart. The building isn't in the greatest shape and it is very old fashioned but it has a slower pace  and more "Peaceful" then the closest Wallmart.

There is a skeleton crew working so the service is hard to find and average at best. The prices are OK but you have to be smart about what you are purchasing. I do enjoy the little ceasars pizza and my kids always get the slushies when we go. I think if they were able to hire some more people it would be much better.

I feel like this review could be summed up in 2 words. Good/overpriced. 

I feel like I could end this review there but I'll elaborate a bit more. I have never had a bad meal from Panera. I love the fresh baked goods, the sandwiches and the soups put it over the top. I also enjoy the drink selection. My favorite is serve yourself iced coffee with 2 sugars and half and half. I could drink this all day. The acia berry tea is also very good. I still want to try the broth bowels but I have heard good things. 

Now the negative. I feel that the prices are pretty high. It's a glorified sandwich shop. I get that all the ingredients are suppose to be fresh but it's a sandwich. Why does it cost $8!?!? That said I'll still be back. If not for the food for the serve yourself iced coffee a muffin and a good book.

This West Mifflin Panera is one of the better restaurants in the area (definitely better than the mall's dismal options or the Chinese buffet in the same plaza). I've dined here and gotten take-out multiple times when we lived in the South Hills several years ago and now again that I work from this area occasionally. It's never disappointed and the service has always been prompt. I'll likely be back.

Since a new management company has taken over, the wifi is awful the music is awful and the music is way too loud.  Music in restaurants is supposed to allow for conversation.  Turn the music down.  Panera is not a nightclub

I am forced to use Panera for catering much to my own dismay at times... as I am more impressed with places like Roma pizza (amazing service, and they can work with any budget even when you are feeding 125+), Chick Fil A, or even Jimmy Johns.  

I continually ask that the spreads do not get put directly on the sandwiches (please put them on the side) as I know they make the sandwiches earlier than the pick up time when things are less busy.  I understand that they do this so that is why I ask... every single time I end up with mushy sandwiches courtesy of this not happening.  Very few locations get this right, if ever.

Amazing food, amazing service, fast easy and nice establishment. I would definitely dine here over many surrounding restaurants in the area. Bread bowl with soup is the best thing! Also their fresh lemonade is superb!

Stopped in over a week before Halloween since an ordered costume was going to not be in for my daughter's school's party, despite being ordered early enough. The store was chaotic and messy. Employees were standing around talking to one another and not helping customers, which there were plenty of parents and children looking for costumes. I asked a young female embloyee next to me for a specific costume, interrupting her conversation with another employee.  She looked at me, hesitated as if it were a bother, but finally called back for my costume.  Without further instruction, she turned and walked away, speaking to another female employee. I asked another parent, who told me to walk around back. I found a table near a set of double doors in the back of the store. It was strewn with bagged costumes and no one there to instruct or ensure the costumes were correct. I found the costume I asked for, in the size I requested, and checked out. It was the most pleasant employee interaction of the excursion. I got home, only to find that part of the costume was missing (wand). After my experience there, I wouldn't recommend it, nor did I return and deal with the hassle.  

For reference, wand was to come with costume: http://www.partycity.com/product/girls+ballerina+bee+costume.do?navSet=280529
Employee Refused Order for fallen police officer officer. They have to fire that employee, or the store needs to be boycotted

It was crazy but we decided to drop in here a few days before Halloween. It was pretty crazy busy, but we were able to find exactly what we needed and at good prices. The line was long but the employees were all nice and doing their best to keep the line moving. I was shocked how quickly we were able to get in and out right before such a busy holiday.

Stay classy Party City
http://www.wpxi.com/news/customer-says-party-store-employee-refused-to-fill-balloon-order-after-learning-its-for-officer/452827834

After using a $15 gift card here on Sunday, Steak N Shake and I are officially friends.

The Guacamole Steakburger, which the fine people at S N S allowed me to customize with fried egg, bacon, and their most excellent Frisco *ahem 1,000 island ahem* sauce that ended up being used as a dipper for the order of ace shoestring fries, is an achievement of fast food, matching the Redhead in price and surpassing her in flavor. 

At S N S, one can watch the globular chopped steak being pressed onto the flatiron grill and thus see for themselves how French-style is the dark horse way to prepare burgers. The edges blacken and crisp, but the internals never lose their fatty, tasteful moisture. 

The Chocolate Chip Cookie Sundae is willing to take on all ice cream shoppe comers with its ideally baked discoids of dough.

S N S prepares a better burger than many independent restaurants, including such local disappointments as Redbeard's. I am willing to risk imprisonment for stating that.

S N S also offers a Chocolate Chip Cookie Sundae that again trumped a non-chain, this being the nightmarish failure sold by The Shiloh Grill. 

Furthermore, the service was stellar, something cannot say about every indie, and that means YOU Shiloh Grill and Redbeard's. When our server sensed that I wasn't mad about my Cherry Limeade (the syrup fell to the bottom), she immediately brought me another soft drink with a beautiful smile on her rosy lips. 

Shoot me, flog me, taser me, bar me from Yelp for eternity, Steak N Shake is everything fast food can be and more. It's fresh, highly edible, very affordable, and served up quick. The decor is dynamically retro and therefore a blast. And this one even has drive-thru as well as late hours! 

I'm sorry, Corporate won this weekend.

We decided to try a quick breakfast at Steak and Shake this morning. We walked in, the place was not full,, workers hanging in the kitchen area. They looked at us a few times and never acknowledged us. After several minutes of not being acknowledged or seated we left and went to Denny's.

After a fun night out I was in desperate need of some drive threw yumminess. To start we pulled up to the window and waited and waited and waited. Finally we picked what we wanted and pulled up to the window. The guy inside opened it and we told them there intercom wasn't working they apologized and took our order. They had us pull threw and wait at the front of the place. Once home I opened my yummy burger and took a nice big bite. It was a bacon BBQ burger and it was good but nothing to write home about. My fried were fresh and quite good however Bry said his tasted like they had been sitting for a while. We also ordered milkshakes. I mine was a strawberry shake with a layer of chocolate on top. Well that's what the picture showed it as. What it turned out to be was a strawberry milkshake with a measly amount of chocolate. It was the littlest tiniest bit. So disappointing.  I think it there was a thick layer of chocolate on this thing you wouldn't be able to keep me away. Alas it was not so. This place has potential they just didn't seam at the top of there game this night. Will try again and hope they deliver.

I don't get this place, I really don't.  I have been to numerous Steak n' Shakes, and they truly are hit or miss--I don't know how they are still in business.  I actually do enjoy their milkshakes, and their burgers aren't terrible. The first time we were at this one, we were told "I'll be with you in one minute" at the drive through.  Seven minutes later, I had to ask if they were still there.  Then 10+ minutes at the window without ANYONE even addressing us.  I actually was calling the Steak n' Shake hotline and waiting to speak to a human in customer service while this was going on.  After nearly 20 minutes, we received our food, which wasn't even hot, and the customer service STILL hadn't picked up.  We get home and one milk shake was only half full and the other was fine.  Today, we were given the "I'll be with you in one minute".  After, given a disclaimer that it would be "Fifteen minutes for a burger, is that OK."  I said we didn't need burgers, then, and was going to order a milkshake, but was cut off by a "Sorry, bye."  Annoyed, we just left.
Good fast service. Good food. Milkshake tasted a bit off, but good experience overall.

We stopped here for a snack and milkshakes on out of Pittsburgh. The food was good and the milkshakes were really good and nice size for the price. I loved our waitress Chrissy who gave my boyfriend a hard time!!
Burgers are okay. Fries are too thin, which means they tend to come out crunchy or cold or both. Shakes are decent. Service is slow and often inattentive.

As we waited for our meal I noticed that one of the employees pants where down to his knees!  And I am not exaggerating!  I made a comment to our waitress that I was offended and that I could not believe that his boss would let him walk around in a place of business like that!  The waitress said yes we have told him many times and walked away!   She proceeded to tell him and the manager on duty! I didn't get his name or the managers wish I would of then I would filed a formal complaint to corporate!  Because when she told both of them they proceeding to give us dirty looks and stare us down!   Now mind you I had my children with me!  We actually felt threatened needless to say we will NEVER Return!

We stopped by here on Saturday (2/14 )night for shake, waitress just looked at us while we were standing by the sign that said " wait to be seated " . Mind you , there were only couple people in the restaurant and no one else is waiting in the line .Clearly they are not busy. So, we waited 5 minute til we finally decided to sit ourselves down and got our own menus . Finally, a waitress sitting on the booth realize we seated ourselves. The place is dirty and couple of the staff looked loopy and unfriendly .

9/21/2015 After leaving the Mac Miller concert, some friends and I decided to break for a bite to eat on our journey home. Inside we were seated and began waiting for almost 10 minutes. We were then approached by our less than competent waiter, Alonzo, who took our orders and then disappeared for almost 20 minutes. He then returned stating that there was no guacamole for the guacamole burger my friend had order. He provided no other suggestions or solutions to the order problem and then walked away. We received our food without ever getting our drinks, silver wear, or so much as a napkin. The restaurant was almost completely empty and the service felt very neglegant. Safe to say I was disappointed with my experience

Every time I go here, I get the Chili Cheese Dog and a burger, usually the same one. It's always hot and fresh, and always tasty. Service can be hit or miss, but there is nowhere in the area you're going to get a burger this good for the price. Period. If their service wasn't so spotty, id give them a solid 5.

We were seated immediately upon entering things, Megan our waitress took our drink orders immediately. When she came back with our drinks she took her food orders, and our food was out within 5 to 10 minutes. It was all hot and delicious, my kids milkshake was also delicious.

Second visit, seated immediately drink orders taken. Blah.... I was charged for guacamole side that had no flavor. Burgers were good, nothing to brag about. 
Went to Arby's after so we wouldn't starve later.  


LAST review. Seated at once, waitress was training a new employee. Got drinks quickly. Then the food. "New" cheddar double burger had more mustard than cheese. I'm just glad I got a side of cheese to make the fries edible.

The food is typical of other Steak and Shakes nothing really to complain about food wise. However service or lack of service is another story. The wait staff is terrible . Basically during our visit they took our order and delivered our food, never to be seen or heard from again. No drink 'refill and had to flag some one down in an attempt to get our bill. The waitresses were constantly bickering with each other and with the manager all in front of customers. While the food is good This is a poorly managed restaurant. Too many choices in the area for me to return to this Steak and Shake.

I've been there late at night when virtually no one else is there and had a long wait for the food. Not the fault of the server, who was very attentive (why wouldn't she have been, the place was empty), but even still, she was very nice and apologetic about the wait, which was the worst part of the experience.

Food was decent. Better than most fast food for a cheap price, but compared to top quality burgers, they are exceedingly average. The shake I had melted absurdly quickly to the point it began leaking over the cup.

Average experience on the whole, though I'll likely go again.

Philly burger is great, but service is less than stellar but honestly u blame the cooks in the back.  If the food isn't right there's only so much the server can do. This particular steak and shake is better than the rest.

Steak and Shake is a place that you're never going to get a stellar service experience. You'll likely wait forever to be seated. Your table will probably be dirty. Your server will probably disappear for almost your entire time there (but not always. I've has some rock star servers here, too. But it is not the norm). Your food will probably take forever to come out, you'll probably never get a refill on your drink, and your check will probably take forever to come. 

The reason that I continue to come here from time to time is because it is VERY cheap, near where I work, and it's always open. Not to mention my love of hot dogs of any variety. 

I typically order a chili cheese frank, which is usually mounding over with chili and cheese. The portion is delicious and generous. Beware, the chili frank comes with raw onions, which is a pretty common turn off for people for whatever reason. However, it's almost always thrown together in a way that somehow makes it even messier than it is by nature. Half the time the bun is ripped in half and you have to try to find a way to eat it and actually get chili into your mouth and not on the plate. The fries are mediocre. I'm not a fan of the ultra thin cut. I have to eat a million of them to feel satisfied. Though, I am addicted to their fry seasoning. I am an avid ketchup lover, and I forego my ketchup to enjoy the seasoning. 

This particular visit I got a plain steak frank with ketchup on it because I wasn't very hungry. It was definitely good as far as hot dogs go (though, as a whole I'd say the general bar for hot dogs is set pretty low..). It's an all beef dog, which gives it a lot of flavor and somehow is more satisfying and filling than other hot dogs, which is purely a figment of my imagination. My friend got a pretty fancy looking burger, and our total came out to $8 and some change. Though the service is crappy (usually..I actually had a wonderful service experience today, which I've probably never been able to say about steak and shake before), the price really can't be beat.

This place is tolerable if you're looking for something quick and cheap, especially late. Other than that, I'd skip it.

Their two namesakes...steakburgers and shakes. They're both average. The shakes are nothing to write home about. The burgers are average. Honestly, their burgers remind me alot of Wendy's.

Their fries are super thin and crispy, definitely tasty. They have chili which is actually VERY good. You can get it served Cincinnati style, which means piled on top of pasta with cheese and onions. Its delicious.

They have good hot dogs, as well. 100% beef and very flavorful. Once, we got their club sandwich and this thing was awesome! We were expecting the turkey to have that waxy, flabby texture of cheap turkey lunch meat. But it looked like it was fresh sliced of a real turkey breast!
Other than that, we haven't tried a whole of their sandwiches, but their menu isn't huge, either.

One thing I like about this place is that they're pretty cheap. They have 8 burger/fry combos that are just $4.00. They also always have coupons in the newspaper. They let you use any many coupons as you want. So the prices are pretty much comparable to regular fast food (or cheaper). Plus...kids eat free on weekends! As long as you order $.8.00 of foot, you get a free kids' meal. Drinks are not included but this is a nice perk. You can get apples or oranges for the kiddies, too, instead of fries.

Service is always fairly awful. The teenage girls they have working there obviously have never had waiting jobs before. You usually only see them once or twice throughout the whole meal. I have a hard time giving them a 15% tip because I know they make minimum wage and they really just take your order and ignore you for the rest of your meal. Once, the service was so awful, the manager just gave me the whole meal for free. I'm not expecting white glove service but a refilled water glass would be nice in  the middle of my meal.

This place is what it is. Its basically just fast food with pseudo-waitresses.
i just ate at steak and shake and let me just say one word grossssss! two thumbs wayyyy down get a better cook hello?! and the white chocolate milkshake tasted like crap!

I was very pleased with the service that I received at MedExpess in Pleasant Hills.  They were friendly and courteous.  One of the receptionists even wished me an early Happy Birthday.  Everyone that I dealt with was friendly and courteous.  The PA Blake took care of me and she was great and knowledgeable.  Altogether I was in and out in 40 minutes.  I arrived at 10:40 on a Sunday morning and was out of there by 11:20.  Thank you !!!

Staff is great. Been going there since they opened 10 yrs ago. If i can get an appt with my doc I will go. Don't mind the extra $20 copay for the convenience. Its better than going to the ER which is a triple copay and triple wait.   This is a convenient doctor office. The staff has changed over the years but the staff has always been aces to me. The PAs there are just as good as the docs. They seem to work long hours and wont complain if u  come in just before close

Made one of the most terrible ordeals we've had with our 16 MO daughter as bearable as could be... Quick and efficient when we got there and checked in at 9AM on a Sunday (very crowded when we left at 10AM), quick triage and  treatment with a friendly PA, and nice service all around. Waiting room was clean with wifi.

Each time I've visited Med Express I've had a pretty pleasant experience. Thankfully, not too often do I have to go. Their check-in is quick and typically do not have to wait long to the exam room. I did wait while in the exam room (just over a half hour.) 
The PA that saw me was thorough and had good bedside manner. You're able to get X-rays as well there that I've had on both visits. Once for a sprained ankle and respiratory. 
I stopped at the emergency room at Jefferson before going to Med Express because they have a quick care place within I "quick"ly left because it was a total disaster there. If you need medical care after hours of your doctor or on a weekend, Med Express is a sufficient substitute. Most times it's not too busy.

I was in town visiting family and had an issue that couldn't wait until I returned home. I was impressed by the efficiency, friendliness and high level of service I received here and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to anyone.

I am fairly pleased with this gym where I've been a member the last several months. I am pleased with the faculty as it has racquetball, basketball courts, cardio, weights and numerous fitness and spinning classes on a daily basis. I don't like the system for cleaning the equipment though which involves paper towels and hand sanitizer essentially. Other gyms where I have been a member have actual cleansing wipes which are much more effective. 

The staff is unfortunately pretty useless as I have never encountered a single person who has been  able to answer any of my questions. For example, I have asked nearly ever person that works there what the length of the pool is and no one can tell me. I finally measured it myself. Fortunately, I am self sufficient and don't require a lot of attention otherwise you might be in trouble here. 

Also, the lifeguard for the pool is not infrequently late in the morning when the pool is supposed to be open which is a problem if you are trying to swim and have limited time. 

Pricing is pretty average at $30 per month unless you want to use the courts, then they charge you $5. There is also and initiation fee which can sometimes be waived if you ask. 

I like this gym and will keep coming only because I like what they offer. It has nothing to do with the staff or pricing unfortunately.

The staff here is awesome!  While some of the equipment could use a bit more cleaning and maintenance, overall everything is in proper working order and is easy to use.  I wasn't always a gym-goer but when we signed up I was determined to make the effort.  My husband and I go together at least 5 times per week.  We have a routine and the placement of the machines makes it very easy to follow the routine and keep up with it.  The staff walk around throughout the workouts to make sure no one is in need of anything.  I've never seen any type of uncleanliness in the restrooms or locker room.  Overall, definitely worth the $30 bucks a month to get a good workout!

vey rude and unprofessional staff starting with Dana, the manager. They continue to withdraw money from your account after you have cancelled and then give you rudeness when you have to call and resolve the matter. Pick another gym.

Me and my bro got a one week pass to LA fitness...which is a plus because many gyms only offer a day pass...tonight was our first night...honestly I was a little weary of going because of the shooting that took place at the Bridgeville LA Fitness last year...but I caved in to say the least...all the while keeping my eyes open. 

It's location is a perk because it next to Panera bread (free Wi-fi people...good place to chill after a hard work out)...also next to Olive Garden (In the event you need to carbo load...great pasta )...and many other stores...It's a 10 minute commute unfortunately from where we live..it was about 10:30pm by the time we arrived...we were greeted by two friendly young bucks...they were informational...telling us the in and outs of the gym...perks is pool, child day care, litte cafe for refreshments or protein, vending machines...spacious spinning room...one basketball court...four racket ball courts...the gym is very much an open layout...meaning you can stand at any point in the gym and see every damn thing...it has two levels...the second level (by way of a staircase) has your bicycle and running equipment which was disturbing for me...am in the healthcare field...am like...how is this accessible for our friends in wheel chairs? you might be thinking...if they in a wheel chair they don't need to be up there right? not the point...apparently they have one of each item on the second floor on the first floor for that reason...not very accommodating for our wheel chair friends (big negative)...ok moving on
...the locker rooms were beautiful...bathroom alright...they have a sauna and showers available...

The biggest positives that make LA fitness one of my favorite gyms...they keep all members and guests well informed...for example...this is the only gym I have every seen...display a sign regarding the hazards of steriod usage (big positive)...throughout the gym they have charts to inform members/guests of there target heart rate...plus hand sanitizer everywhere!...my biggest plus...they have an AED machine positioned in the front of the lobby area which is easily accessible to any member/guest... and for that " I am a fan ! "  

P.S. according to the LA Fitness website...the correct address for this facility is as follows: 

PLEASANT HILLS
601 CLAIRTON BLVD., UNIT 38 
PLEASANT HILLS,  PA   15236

LA Fitness sales is not trustable. They have to "visually" display the "Refund" policy.

No Refund After THREE Days.

Refund Notice has to be received by the club of the enrollment in person, or mailed to LA Fitness at P.O. Box 54170, Irvine, CA 92619-4170. Refund is not acknowledged unless customers can legally proof they had followed all requirements for the refund.

Bottom line, they are very sharp clean looking sales to get your money in their pockets. It's not their concern if you are informed with truth. They will tell you whatever you want to hear even it's not true according to the contract.

Customers will not stay with LA Fitness at Pleasant Hills, once they have the disgusting taste with their dishonesty. There are plenty fitness center to choose from. The top notch is Healthtrax. They are medical professionals. The cost is expensive, but you get more than any gyms can provide. Plus, they don't lie. It separates the professionals and street clubs.

For low budget but professional weight loss and body building, Fitness 19 is something you shall consider. Environment is friendly. Trainers are professional. It's $25/month include a body fat measurement/analysis monthly, and $19 dues Lock-in fee. For trainers, I got $162 for six sessions. Plus there is not tricky 12 month commitment. People comes and goes as their life changes. Unlike LA Fitness only wants to make money from having people join (you will see their initiation fee is extreme high $99), not having them stay.

Anyway, they kill all the funs of working out. They have very bad sales there. If you do consider join, bring the contact home, read it through, and think about it. The sales WILL tell you lies although they look like descent nice guys. I made a mistake. Be careful!

I like this gym, good place to work out. The sauna room need to upgrade. If you go there watch out an old woman wear huge ridiculous towel on her head in swimming pool. She is very noisy and she act like she own the gym. My day is never relax when she around.  Hope it good tip to you.

This location, when not being compared to the other locations in the area (South Side and Robinson) is pretty nice. It is always clean, and I like that the machines are pretty spread apart. As always they could use more cardio machines and it's silly that the pool closes at 4pm on Saturday and they do not warn you. Overall a pretty decent option for the area.

Do not join if you hope to use the pool.  This location has ongoing maintenance problems.  They pool has been closed many times in the last 4 months due to ventilation system breakdowns. (and the building is only a few years old)  Also, the cleanliness is deteriorating

Every time we visit the area we stop here. The staff at the front desk is always very helpful and its an easy check in. The facility is always clean. I think they could use more racks for back squats and such. I only saw one. And there weren't enough clips for a very minimal amount of people needing them.

My husband and I started attending the gym in the fall of 2012. He loves to go to the gym and workout and I wanted to get in shape but was unfamiliar with the equipment and the best way to use it to benefit me the most. That is when I met Wil. He is a personal trainer at the gym and in one word, he is AMAZING! He is completely intimidating and very helpful. He shows me which machines to use in which order to get the best workout in the shortest amount of time. He shows me how to adjust each machine (bc the diagram doesn't always work for women). He pushes me to do well and to work hard but never makes me feel as though I am not working hard enough. He works with me to accomplish my goals and makes suggestions to change workouts where needed. My husband (the big lifter) now uses Wil too and he feels the exact same way. That Wil pushes him to accomplish his goals and get him into the shape he wants to be.

The only downfall of this gym is that I go after work and there are a lot of people there, but there are always some machines available, you just might have to wait a few minutes.

So, many people keep commenting on how clean this gym is, but I very strongly disagree. I have had a membership for about a year. I go pretty sporadically and every time I have gone and tried to get into a routine, I have gotten sick within a week. A lot of gyms have spray bottles and towels at every few machines for members to use and are expected to use. This is not the case at L.A. there are two paper towel and sanitizer dispensers up stairs and downstairs, but no one uses them and it doesn't seem to get the job done. So, even if you use the sanitizer, it is difficult to get rid of all the built up germs and sweat. 

On top of the cleanliness issue, I felt pretty humiliated by one of the personal trainers there. They let you have a free session every so often. Well, I took a free session and afterwards she pressured me to sign up and was pretty condescending when I said I couldn't afford it. I'm a recently married graduate student still paying off my undergrad loans so 45 dollars a month on top of the 20 for the gym membership is just not going to happen. She said everyone has a dollar fifty a day to spare. Well honey, I don't.

Gary Fritch is the guy to see! We bought a Toyota RAV4 and Gary was with us from beginning to end explaining all of the details regarding the car and the deal. We are very pleased with the car and with the customer service we received from Gary.
Very helpful staff especially Tony Evans. Test drove the RAV4 & settled on the AWD version. Thank you for saving the day, Toyota. Will be back for oil changes and car washes!
I love these guys and their high end service. Toyota I believe makes a great car!
Waited 1.5 hrs for an oil change with no explanation or apology given. Do NOT wait for your service, either arrange for a ride or drop off. Yikes!
Pleasant car purchasing experience. Polite & knowledgeable staff. Glad to be a part of the Day Toyota family. Will definitely continue my business here! Special thanks to Salesman Gary Fritch!
Everyone here is extremely helpful and friendly. I was having some issues with my inspection being new to PA but they talked me through the laws and everything I needed to do to get a passing grade!

Absolutely the best car buying experience I have ever had.  They are efficient, very friendly and accommodating.  Jorge went out of his way to make sure that I got what I wanted, with no pressure.  I've had a lot of bad experiences with car dealerships, so this was a great change for me.  Definitely give them a consideration first!!

Jorge was great during the sales process and made usual painful experience much more bearable. Love my new RAV 4 SE and Jorge took the time to show me all the features. And he made it fun. We even gave my car a name!

Just purchased my second vehicle at Day Toyota. The salesman, Gary, was extremely helpful and made the process of purchasing a new car pleasant. He has been with this company for years and always has a smile on his face. 

I would be remiss in not mentioning the Service Writer, Tony.  He is thorough in helping to get my car in and out quickly. If need be, he has had me interface with the mechanic to ensure I understood why the particular service was being recommended. 

The service waiting room and the showroom are impeccably clean. I highly recommend this dealership.

I was extremely impressed with the staff at Day Toyota Scion. This was my first experience purchasing a vehicle, and I was pleased with the service. John was extremely knowledgeable about the Prius brand, and was able to answer all of my questions with ease. I appreciated that even though I brought my dad, John made sure that he directed the most attention to be as the primary decision maker. 

Test drove the Prius c and Rav4. As a result of the great service, expertise, and transparency, I bought the Prius, and was even able to take it home that day. Looking forward to working with them in the future.

Worst overall experience ever with a dealership. The beginning went well, that was until the deal was complete. Ever since the deal was complete, the dealer was helpless and ignorant. I should have used my better judgement and stayed with C Harper or Day Ford. 

I would recommend looking elsewhere for your car buying experience.

I have bought three Hyundais here in the past 2 years.  I have always worked with Bernie and he has given me good deals every time.  I already knew which car I wanted when I would go in, so there wasn't a lot of haggling which I appreciated.  He never tried to talk me into a more expensive car either.  Also, their finance department is the best.  Each time I have gone in, I have gotten an incredible interest rate and wasn't talked into anything I didn't want.  I would highly recommend this dealer.

I bought my third vehicle here just recently, my second Hyundai. WE went to Bowser because it is close to my wife's office and we have never had any repair issues with them . She drops her car off there and they take her to work. We were looking for an all wheel drive car/suv and they are one of the only dealerships to have the 3 that we wanted. We went with our salesman to test drive a Subaru Crosstrek, a Nissan Rogue, and the Hyundai Tucson. We never felt hurried and when we were done, we said we have to decide. We didn't talk price then and it was just a question which vehicle my wife felt the most comfortable in. We did our research as far as pricing and driver reviews and went with the Tucson. We went back the next Saturday and told them what options we wanted. He gave us the price and it was a couple of hundred dollars below what I expected them to come in at. We were satisfied at the price and we did the deal. They just had to order the color we wanted. It came in 2 days later. We got financing through them at a lower rate than my bank, PNC was giving me. Everything was handled very smoothly. They have always been very easy to deal with. I anticipate purchasing a new Subaru Legacy in the next year and I'm sure I'll buy it through them
Very unhappy with the sales people did not do what they said they would do service department is very good

I am rating Hyundai only.

Do you do your due diligence on cars? Do you dislike pushy salespeople? Do you know as much about the vehicle you're going to buy as the salesperson?  Then you should like this dealer.  They are relatively no-nonsense.
I worked with Ed Doyle a couple times in the past to buy my wife's car, to buy my truck, and to buy another car for my brother in law.
Even though he couldn't get us the deal we wanted on the car for my brother in law, he never tried to take advantage of us. He steered us in a good direction, so to speak.

They are straightforward, they are all business, and won't act condescending or patronizing.  I would highly recommend them as a dealer in the area.

I bought my first car, a Nissan Versa, over a year ago. I initially looked here because their service center treated my boyfriend so well. I was very impressed with the honesty of their salesman and I walked away satisfied with the price of the car. Now I'm in for a check up, and their service center is the best I've ever been in. They're polite, and they talk to you like a human being. I will certainly be back next time I need a car, and I recommend this dealership to anyone.

Love this place! There is only one guy there that I do not trust and everyone there knows it.. I'll leave him anonymous. But! For mike and Ryan, they are the nicest guys ever. They really helped me both times I was there, kept me informed on who was working on my vehicle, the experience that person had, and called me immediately when all was finished. They're very efficient, quick, and reliable. I know my Subaru wrx is in good hands with them. Very trustworthy people and I would recommend!

The Subaru service center has the worst customer service I've ever experienced.  It's pretty obnoxious to  stand and wait unacknowledged while two employees finish their conversation.  Especially when one of them appears to be the manager.  I worked in customer service for almost 12 years.  I understand that it may have been a very important conversation, but at the very least, acknowledge your customer and say something like, I'll be right with you...ect,.  It is incredibly rude to make said customer stand there and wait for 5 minutes.  Even though this location is very convenient for me, I will not be back.

Back at Subaru today and received what I like to call spa like service! I am greeted  by all of the employees who know my name. By the time I sat down with my coffee, the oil change was completed. My all time favorite employer, Mike Z. Explained in layman terms the benefits of buying new tires now vs. waiting and gave me a price quote, letting me know to shop around. My car sparkled after a classy touch of a car wash which much needed after our first heav

So after going through the process of leasing a car... I would definitely not recommend Bowser Subaru. We were told that all we had to do was go pick up the car, to find out that none of our paperwork was done. We spend 3 hours waiting for the finance and sales dept to figure things out. The entire time we were treated as young children that did not know anything--- gave the true meaning to "used car salesman." Oh, and the entire time we were there they blamed us for "showing up unannounced"--- I guess that is what you get for calling ahead?
The service dept here sucks. Tried to get me to pay for a head gasket repair at 37K mi on my pontiac and wouldn't look at my chevy.

5 Stars for the Bowser Subaru Service Team - have had my 2011 Impreza in 3 times. Twice for recall work and a rattling heat shield and once for what I thought was a coolant leak. Turned out the coolant leak was nonexistent and was probably coming from another car in the driveway. No leaks, so they topped off my fluids and didn't charge me a dime. Wonderful to find a service center that is honest.

Good, fast, and cheap: they do exist all in the same place at Bowser Subaru!

My out-of-warranty Subaru Legacy had squeaky brakes, a broken headlight, skipping wiper blades, and balding tires.  I called Bowser's service department, and after speaking with Matt, who was very cordial, they started working on my car as soon as I brought it in.  At first I was suspicious that their prices beat the local shops and common chains in the PIttsburgh area; surely the dealership had some hidden, non-itemized charges or astronomically expensive labor.  This was not the case. 

My headlight requires removal of the wheel-well cover, a job that one third-party service provider quoted as $100 for an hour of labor alone.  Since I already had the bulb, Matt told me his Subaru mechanics could change it in 20 minutes for $10!  Here's what really astounds me, Bowser checked my brake pads, which had been squeaking, and recommended that I wait to buy new ones since my current pads were well within safe limits, all for free.  

Later, Matt explained that I needed new tires and that he could get me out the door for $410.  Naturally, I didn't believe him because I've been conditioned to assume dealerships swindle their patrons.  I was wrong.  The tires he sold me are offered at Wal-Mart for only $19 less, a bargain considering $76 is less than a third the cost some service centers charge for attaching and aligning new tires.  Finally, when I requested new wiper blades, the service techs let me know that for less money I could simply replace the rubber instead of the entire blade itself.

Overall, better quality, better prices, and better service than other dealerships and third-party mechanics.  Matt and his team truly exceeded every single expectation I had.  My whole life I have heard that if it's too good to be true, it is; Bowser Subaru's service department is the exception that proves the rule.
About what you'd expect. nothing great nothing terrible. Price was fair and the selection decent. I really don't have strong feelings about this business either way...

I had a running light that burned out on my Impreza. I brought my car right up to the Subaru express service and they took it right away! Everyone in the Subaru service department is nice and helpful! Thank you to Mike Zuro, the Subaru Assistant Service Manager!

Every experience i have had at Bowser has been TOP NOTCH! Juan DeLavega was my salesman and did a great job working out a deal with me on a 2012 Legacy. I took it in today for its 3000 mile service and their service department is awesome as well! Nick took great care of my car and this was above any level of service Ive ever experienced at a car dealership. Will definitely be back for service and a new car when its time!

The rating here is for the staff and shady tricks this company plays. 
Recently, i received a coupon in the mail for 20% off an item. I stopped in and found a dresser in the clearance section for around $550. I asked if the coupon would apply and was given a yes. I was unsure if i really wanted the dresser so i left to think more about it. I returned the following day to reconsider the dresser and was being followed by a pushy salesman. I told him i was still considering the dresser, but it was a bit overpriced even with the 20% off coupon. Immediately, he started saying the coupon did not apply to clearance items. I told him I was told it would be honored by 2 other employees and he got very irritated and said, " yeah, well it shouldn't apply, we are just helping you out, but its not actually valid like you think." -What a dick.

Keep in mind this is the clearance section so these pieces have scratches/ dents etc... I decided to offer a more fair price. I asked if they can reconsider the price. The salesman said, "Its $550." 
I asked if the store would be willing to take "500 plus the 20% off."
The response was a very rude/ laughing at me " Its 20% off $550!" - complimented with a smug grin and eye roll. 
And in that single second- the sale was lost... but it gets better!

I told the salesman I was no longer interested, but if i found anything else I would let him know. A couple minutes later, my family and i went to leave the clearance section. We walked past the salesman without saying anything to him. Yet he turned and loudly said "You're Welcome!"

I checked with my family to see if anyone had thanked him, or if he was just being a sarcastic jerk. No one said anything to him... so that was sure pleasant.   

About 10 minutes later, i found a nicer dresser in the showroom area for about $800, my Mom went to get the salesman who was about 20 feet away. She approached him and another salesmen, both of which fully ignored her... probably writing us off as cheap and not worth his time. Finally, another saleswoman came to assist us. She was much more pleasant, however, she kept pushing to buy the whole bedroom set. We ended up leaving for the time being, possibly to return and buy the more expensive dresser this week, but honestly, the first salesman left such a bad taste in our mouths that none of us wish to support this business.
I've contacted the store through calls, emails and facebook. They have no plans to help fix anything on a chair that completely fell apart less than a year old. Do not shop here!

I can't directly comment on the quality of the furniture here because I've only had my bedroom set for about a year now and so far it seems ok besides the fact that its easily scratch-able.

My complaint comes from the staff themselves, one individual in particular. I refuse to go in there anymore, and on the rare occasion I go in to shop for the bedroom/living room furniture that I need for my new house, I immediately leave if I see he's working. 

I had about an hour to kill the other day and decided to go in to look around for a new dining room set. Within the first 3 minutes of being there I forgot I had to make an important call. So while I'm literally on the phone, this gentleman comes over and tries talking to me/selling to me mid conversation. Of course I ignore him and continue my conversation while I look around the store. Not even ten minutes later I hear a "psst!! pssst!!!" I look over and its the same guy, waving and trying to get my attention. Keep in mind I'm still on the phone. So my slow browsing turned into fast glancing which turned into me bolting out of the store. 

I understand these people work on commission for the most part, but I cannot stand the "car salesman" type pressure I receive when I go in this store. Especially to be so rude as to interrupt my conversation not only once but twice. I'll never go back there while that man is working.

I love this vet even more after today my dog got in to the trash an eat a bunch of chicken bones an was pooping so much blood I called them they told me to bring her right in no problem helped us change her wellness plane to help with cost of her care but above all they saved my dogs life so we didn't have to Brake are to small children's harts by losing there dog I will forever be grateful to the amazing staff an doctors who helped save an care for my baby are dog is not just a dog she is family an they love an care for her just as We would

At this point I don't think I can give them a great review . I like this pet clinic in that it is easy to get an appointment, and the vet techs are fantastic.

I do have issue with the quality of some of the veterinarians that I have seen. This is a perfect clinic for you if you're only going for regular checkups or to spay or neuter your pets. However if you have older pets or have a more complicated issue I would strongly recommend you go elsewhere.

I struggle with naming names because I don't want to damage someone's professional reputation. It is possible that my cat had extremely complicated issues that they had not seen before, I don't know I do want to start by saying that these veterinarians were extremely kind and professional. I just think they might need a little bit more experience or maybe more used to dealing with more straightforward veterinary issues

I saw doctors A. and Dr Thornton and while both were very nice and kind towards my animals I don't think that they are extremely experienced veterinarians. Dr Thornton misdiagnosed my cat after being unable to read an xray of his stomach and told me he probably had cancer. What he had was just a simple infection that was cured with antibiotics.  Dr A is extremely kind and I've only seen him once, but there's something in his bedside manner that doesn't give me a lot of confidence in his knowledge as a vet and I think its the fact that he says um and like a lot on the phone. 

Twice I paid $150 for x-rays which were not included in my plan, and the vet said that they couldn't really read the x-ray and for $70 more they could send it out for a radiography. What the fresh hell what is the point of me getting an xray if you can't read it?

I ended up euthanizing my cat a few days ago which was very sad and during the procedure both otechs and dr. A were so so nice. But I don't have a lot of faith and the vets at this clinic and I probably won't bring my other cat back here

Banfield is just awful. After reading glowing Yelp reviews of Banfield, I took my newly adopted puppy for her vaccinations. They told me I would save money on the Wellness Plan, and no one ever mentioned anything about a contract or having to pay money to cancel the contract - all they told me was that I would save money with it. So I signed up. (BTW no one ever provided me with a copy of any contract, and I don't recall ever signing one, so I don't believe there ever was a contract. They just like to use litigious wording to intimidate people)

Our puppy was itching uncontrollably, so we asked the vet to address the issue. They shaved the pup's arm, for apparently no reason, and in the following days the itching situation exploded. We took the pup back in, asked the vet, "Do you think it is food allergies?" She (Dr. K. Thornton) responds, "Yes it is, I'll prescribe you all this medicine and a special (expensive) food." SHE DID NOT RUN ONE SINGLE TEST TO CONFIRM IT WAS FOOD ALLERGIES.

Long story short, we spent over a thousand dollars and went to Banfield 2-3 times a week for months because the vet misdiagnosed our dog! The whole time we were forced to watch our puppy suffer and itch herself raw, developing several bald spots all over her body. The whole time we had faith in the vet that the situation would improve. Well, it DIDN'T while we followed the vet's instructions, which included giving our dog a steroid (which ultimately proved useless since our dog NEVER HAD FOOD ALLERGIES).

Finally, one night at around midnight our puppy looked near death, after being lethargic and not eating anything all day. We took her to an ER and spent another $300, but it saved her life. The ER vet gave us a topical antibiotic, and that is when we finally saw an improvement in her health.

She never had food allergies. SHE HAD DEMODECTIC MANGE AND WAS BEING EATEN ALIVE BY MITES! I had to diagnose the health problem myself after spending countless hours doing research. I've never been trained to be a vet, and yet I was able to do her job 100x better because I accurately diagnosed the problem. A different vet took skin scrapings to confirm that it was demodectic mange, NOT food allergies.

And when we told the vet of her horrible mistake? Dr. K. Thornton didn't even apologize for the pain and suffering we went through due to HER negligence!

And now, almost a year later, after I have discontinued using their services and told them that I wish to cancel and never agreed for a renewal of anything, they are STILL attempting to charge me for their "Wellness plan" each month! BANFIELD IS AWFUL, and they might just kill your pet.

Dr. Waters. Was  amazing let me tell you why. She was very kind, inviting, and cheerful, she handled my dog gently and broke down all procedures, the what and how and why's of things.. I really can't find anything to complain about it it was a very good experience. I would recommend

Composite review for over 8 years.

I have dropped my annual "subscription" to Banfield.  It made no economic sense for my 3 cats (now down to 1).  The vet service has always been excellent; receptionists fine.  Vet techs -- engaged and helpful.  But financially, it no longer makes sense for a single cat, for me at least.  My rating has nothing to with service or staff.

f8 and be there.

This place is awesome!!!!! The staff is so friendly and attentive to our dog!!!!! I would recommend them to anyone! 

We walked in today and they greeted our dog by name, I have never had a veterinary office do that. Also, one of the vet techs who had treated our dog last visit came in the room just to say hi! We were so touched!

They also call a couple days after visits to see how your pet is doing and if you have any more questions. Not too many places do that anymore. The level of care is extraordinary.

We were in Petsmart on a separate occasion with our dog just shopping and one of the techs came up to say hi to us. She asked how he was doing and fussed over him in the store. 

Then on another occasion in Petsmart, another staff member that treated our dog came up and warmly greated us. 

What great dog people!

The office and rooms are really clean and nicely decorated. 

I love the pet plans that they offer, they are great for maintaining good health and wellness. Plus all your sick visits are free on the plan. The only thing you would have to pay for is medicine if needed. 

The long hours are a plus too!!!

Hands down the best fast food chain out there !!  This location especially has excellent service with an extremely polite staff!  Never a bad meal or an incorrect drive thru order.  Always the old standby when you can't decide where to eat !
This is the nicest Chik Fil A I have ever been to. I occasionally visit late after work through the drive thru and the employees are always so nice and really live their job!

Counter service was friendly and efficient.  However, the coleslaw was bland because it didn't have any dressing. I asked and received an order of fries as a replacement, but potatoes were not fully cooked......oh well!
This place tonite was very understaffed, I go here allot and never seen such a lack of employees, they had a hard time giving the. Usual chick-fil-a service that I usually get here
Seems like a pretty standard Chick-Fil-A. Nothing out of the ordinary. Good fast food at a slightly premium fast food price.

After a so-so experience at the new Old Town Buffet on 51, I was a bit hesitant to try Yu's in the Southland Shopping Center. I'm not to keen on Asian buffets as I mentioned in previous reviews, so it took some bribing to get me through the door. All I can say is, I'm so glad the bribe worked!

The last time I was here was years ago before it went under new ownership. It was a typical American buffet... cheap and did the trick. Yu's is that and more. Comparing it to the other location on 51 (I'm not sure, but they may have the same owner), EVERYTHING is better. From selection, food temperature and atmosphere. They have at least 8-10 stations to visit and the variety of food is amazing. I even found myself eating more of the Asian choices because everything was just that good. The ratio of American food to Asian food is pretty equal... From salads, to meat, to pasta and even sushi (it's enclosed in a case and is considered "the Sushi Bar") you will find something you like.  Service was good, too. Though, at a buffet you're not interacting too much with waitstaff. 

For only about $13 a dinner, it was well worth the price and I will most definitely return.

I can't find anything bad to say about this place. That being said, some items are a little lackluster. The food is hot, and there are many items on the buffet to enjoy, both Asian and American. Items like the egg drop soup and dumplings are definitely missing something to make them "pop", but they certainly aren't bad. Service is good too. They make sure your glass is filled and take your empty dishes away promptly.

This is probably the best deal in town, especially for lunch, and especially if you like sushi. I don't but still eat here fairly often because of the huge selection of food on the buffet, and most of it is pretty good.

Ate here today and found it quite reasonable. For a weekend lunch buffet it is $8.79 + tax, tip. This place is HUGE. You could probably sit 200 people in there. The quality of the food is not that fantastic, as one usually expects at a buffet, but there is a lot of variety. This is not really a place for vegetarians to go to however.

The sushi situation needs improvement. There is a tiny bar where only one guy can make a few pieces at a time, so if the sushi line gets slammed, if will take you forever to get any. It would be better if they had a larger sushi bar with a few guys just working full time on the sushi putting out some plates of it.

Didn't get any water refill though, so I was disappointed about the service. But overall, I would be inclined to check this place out again. The main attraction for me is the sushi however. You can also get sushi to go and the prices looked reasonable. 

The exterior looks crappy, but the interior is quite nice. And they play traditional Chinese music. I love it when Chinese restaurants do this instead of playing the 'soft hits of the 90s.'

Food Quality/Taste = 3
Portion Size Given Price = 5 Stars
Price = 4 Stars
Service = 2
Experience with Staff = 3 Stars
Decor = 4

Went here today for lunch found out they closed down, moved to the old Tambellini's on rt 51 towards pgh. Sry to see them move heard landlord raised rent higher. I live in plum so thats a far drive but i might travel to try them there. Today's 9/16/14

one of my favorite buffets in pittsburgh. yu's offer a huge selection of asian food AND american food for the kids who may not be big fans of chinese food yet. they also have a wonderful sushi bar where customers can requests custom sushi rolls for the dinner menu!
 
the mongolian grill allows you to be creative in the creation of your own stir fy! for weekend dinners, you can also order steak and have it grilled right in front of you. and the endless crablegs at dinner. omg! the wealth of options and variety at yu's is awesome and even more mind boggling is how affordable it is! I recommend this very very highly! 

they also have a monthly drawing for customers (children and seniors) to win free meals! I loveee yu's old town buffet!

Visited here late March 2014. Very disappointed. $15 a head for dinner and not a single member of the family enjoyed their meal. The low points: italian chicken (awful taste), mashed potatoes (wickedly plain), and the salmon (indescribable). The high points: fried rice (excellent taste) and the pizza (tastes like a baseball game pizza, but in a good way). The staff was highly attentive and courteous, but ignored us after we paid the bill and gave a generous tip (we always tip well). If you're going to buy a meal in the local area, look elsewhere. I wish we did.

I good buffet with lots of western and Asian items. From the name I had no idea it was an Asian buffet. During lunch today, I particularly like the London Broil cooked to medium, mashed potatoes, and corn. The apple strudel was excellent!

Sushi is while you wait and it wasn't busy, so I had the chef fix me up some Salmon sushi. The rice isn't great, but the fish was actually pretty good. I wasn't hungry enough to try the Mongolian grill, but it looked nice.

Not up to the level of Hokkaido, but cheaper especially for dinner.

I took my whole family to this restaurant for the first time. With 6 of us, it is sometimes hard to find something where the prices are reasonable and the food is good. We all had plenty to eat. Their buffet had something for everyone, including my daughter who asks for Macaroni and Cheese at every place we go. They also have online printable coupons at their website to save money at both the lunch buffet and dinner buffet. I highly recommend going with a family or larger group. They were busy tonight, but there was plenty of room to sit. The food was coming out as quickly as the trays were being emptied. My only regret was there were some crab leg hogs and I was unable to get any, but that is not the fault of the restaurant. We definitely plan on going back!

When I go to a buffet, I  don't expect gourmet. Usually when I choose a buffet its because I really can't decide where else to go and they have a lot of variety. OTB is a great place for days like that, there are so many dishes to choose from, asian style and American and they have a hibachi grill. A few of my favorites are the creamed spinach (which a lot of the city buffets don't offer), seaweed salad, kimchi, hot & sour soup, tofu and mixed veggies, the crab rangoon are pretty tasty as well. All-in-all, its a good place for those days I don't feel like cooking and cleaning up or can't put a finger on what I'm craving.

Thankfully, my grandmother has basically no concept of the internet. I don't think she has ever been online before. And most certainly she would think that yelp is something a dog says.

I can't stand this place. And she just loooooves to come here. I have probably eaten here at least half a dozen times (once on Thanksgiving of all days). The food is pretty good. It is a buffet after all, so it isn't totally trash. But just looking around the place, I want to call in the special investigators of the fashion police. There is just something about the place that irritates me. But hey. As far as everyone else knows, I think this place is great. If my grandma likes it, I like it more. Whatever makes her happy.
Great service. The app is a little testy at times, but that's technology for you. Love the coupons & 99 cent special from 2pm-6pm. One of my fav places!

Dunkin is always good, but I like this location. It's close to my house, which is obviously a plus. I like to drink coffee, and they have a drive thru, so I end up there several times a week. The donuts are usually always fresh. The staff are friendly and service is always fast and accurate whether we eat in or drive thru.
I go to DD when there isn't a Starbucks around. My favorite drink is an Iced Hazelnut Latte. The also have a pretty tasty donut that is a donut and croissant joined together. It's a must try.

Consistently good iced coffees! Just don't forget to always stir the goodness that falls to the bottom of the cup! 
Great muffins and donuts too!
Very courteous employees that consistently make the best coffee in the area.  Huge supporter of the community.  Every trip to this store is a nice experience.
I often stop in here with my teenage son.  I get a black coffee and he gets a coffee with a carmel swirl, and he usually gets a free donut by completing the survey on the receipt. How cool is that?!

About what you expect a donut joint to be. not clean, not filthy. I am going to go back I cant lie but its not a place that stands out in my book. The people are nice but its near a low rent apartment complex (which isn't their fault) but the clientele can be a bit lets say "gruff".

Walked in here tonite at 830pm no donuts was out .place look like no one was in there working  . All I heard was two girls taking . The one girl told the other worker she had some one to wait on up front. She continued to talk, and me and my son walked out. Piss poor service, place is open till 10 , donuts should be out and shouldn't look like they are closed!

Write a Review for Dunkin Donuts?! Well, DO NUT mind if I do! This Dunkin Donuts is located in one of the most upbeat, playful neighborhoods in the south hills! The drive-thru is convenient, I will say that. They didn't put Splenda in my iced coffee which was kinda disappointing. That's okay, I only reminded the lady about 5 times. Just be clear on what you want and maybe, just maybe, they'll throw in a bear claw!

I love Dunkin Donuts in general so five stars there!!! Their donut holes are delicious!  I am impressed overall though with their late hours and variety of coffee selection.

Most of the Dunkin Donuts in my area are open until midnight. You can go into the locations until 10 p.m. and then the drive thru is open until midnight. Now for some people this might not mean much, but for a shift worker, night owl, and coffee addict, this means the world to me!  Let's face it, coffee never tastes as good as when it is made by someone else. The fact that Dunkin is practically always open is awesome for coffee lovers. 

I got the vanilla latte and it was really good, not too sweet and it kept me energized. I do like the vanilla cappuccino better though.  I have gotten their iced coffees before and  they are good too. The girl at the drive thru window was really nice as well. The service was quick, especially since I believe she was the only one there.

This location has really gone down hill fast.  Terrible customer service, continually messing up orders.  And please tell me how you can forget to mention that you don't have a cup carrier for a large order of drinks?  And then look at me like it's my fault for coming and buying your product... :(

I stop at this store a few times a week because I love their donuts and chi tea and it is close to work.  I get the same thing every time I go.  The people that work here are friendly. I would give 5 stars but the consistency of the quality of their donuts and how they make their drinks changes from day to day.  Most of the time everything is great but there are those days the donuts taste steal and look smashed or carelessly filled with jelly or cream.  And for my tea, how can you mess that up,  they always taste good but some days my drink is only 3/4 of the way full and others it is topped off.  If this location could improve on this I will change to 5 star.  If not I will keep it a 4 for now...
I went there for a group get together & ate the buffet. There was a lot of different options and they were all tasty! Will be back soon.

Rarely if ever do I leave a bad review. However, since my mother failed to warn me, I felt compelled to warn others of this horrible experience. Sparing them the agony that I endured.

Perhaps it sounds a bit much when describing an experience at a buffet. I mean, come on, this is a buffet. How good could be. How bad could it be? Better thank this.

Anyone, who believes this is the best buffet on the face of the earth, hasn't been to the Grand China Buffet in Bridgeville. Not that the food at Bridgeville is especially amazing, but the Hibachi there is worth the price of the buffet. (A dollar cheaper per adult and they charge .60 per year on a kid.)

To me, any buffet with the hibachi grill, is worth it. If the hibachi grill is good. Unless you go to Fortune Star. The food is greasy and taste like a dirty grill. The man who cooked it, looked like he wanted to spit in my food, as if he was thinking, 'why do I have to cook for you.'. He was unpleasant and unkempt. 

The most positive thing I can say about this place is the wait staff, they were pleasant enough. They didn't go out of their way but they still were pleasant. Unlike Hibachi man.

There wasn't much to choose from. Eight stations. One for ice cream, dessert, salad bar, cold food, appetizers, American food, hot food entres and one for hibachi toppings. That's it. Nothing stood out. Absolutely nothing was outstanding.

It wasn't even average. It was below average. And it would've been semi tolerable had when I received the bill not have nearly fallen out of the booth. Even with 10% off, I wanted to die. Now, I am not cheap when it comes to buying a meal. I'll go to Bonefish. If the food is good. I will gladly pay for it. But this was not worth $12 an adult, seven dollars a child, and 2.50 a beverage. And... tea is not free! Back up, just for a six year old, seven year old with two sodas, $19.00! Are you kidding me? That much for just two kids. That was their portion. 

It pained me, absolutely pained me to pay that bill. The kids barely ate. They gagged. 

To top it off, I nearly broke a hip and fell when they failed to put signs up on the soaking wet freshly mopped floor.

The hostess did yell out a warning after I crossed the linoleum of death. Yeah, thanks, I wish you warned me BEFORE I ate.

All the way home with a knot in my stomach I kept thinking, "all that money I just spent for me, my daughter and the two kids, I could've gone to many different places." 

Granted, $45 is not the end of the world, for less, I could've gotten a halfway decent meal at Eat and Park, For the same amount, I could have gone to Applebee's and got a cocktail, or saved $15 by taking a ride to the Bridgeville buffet and left satisfied.

Being a good daughter I decided to call my mother on the way home, warning her not to go there, and her response was, "Oh, that place. Worst place on the face the earth don't go there."
"Ug, why didn't you tell me?"
"I just did."

If you are thinking of cashing in that coupon and going to Fortune Star, do yourself a favor ... don't. Go somewhere else.

Jon H. Must not have gone to the same buffet that I went to. The food is fantastic! They have plenty of options to choose from including sushi, a make your own hibachi style grill, various types of chicken, shrimp, fish, and steak just to name a few! The service here is some of the best I've had from a buffet. My favorite part was the hibachi grill. You're able to choose from a variety of ingredients and they cook it right in front of you in seconds! The interior of restaurant is very classic while staying modern. I will absolutely be coming back for more visits! Don't just take my word on it, come try it for yourself!

Complete waste of time, effort, and money! Food was "fresh" but very bland taste. Crappy takeout from a hold in the wall probably would taste better ! Bad service, waitress had plenty of attitude problems and owner yelled across the room her dinner table for someone to come to the register to ring us up. Never again!

We really needed this in the area. I had to settle for Giant Eagle sushi for a while. I like it much better than the Buffett that was there before. They did a beautiful job with the renovation. The prices are very reasonable. The food choices are plentiful. I love their honey chicken. The sushi selection could be bigger, but they always have what I eat. I am just so thrilled that this place opened

This restaurant just opened up a couple weeks ago. Figured we'd give it a shot since a 10% discount was mentioned on facebook, 

Since a buffet's most important trait is the food, and since this place is so new, we expected the food to be decent. Not really the case. There are a ton of options, but options alone aren't enough. The quality was average buffet fare at best. 

They serve Chinese, Sushi, American, salads, and ice cream (scoop type). While a few of the foods were decent, overall most lacked flavor or were very bland. 

To top it off, when we mentioned the 10% off discount, it wasn't honored. I don't see a reason to return here.

Good Food, Totally Remodeled

If you used to go to the other Chinese Buffet that was here, you will be pleasantly surprised to see that the Fortune Star is totally remodeled. This place is very nice, the food is good with a nice selection and hot. 

There is a nice sushi bar and a fresh grill. 

We really like the Fortune Star in Monroeville but this is much closer to home and we will be steady customers.
Awesome atmosphere and dinner... I had steak and the best fried rice I have ever had tonight.  The staff are wonderful and very good.  The pepper steak was so tender...  All and all a great buffet!

I hate leaving bad reviews, but this place was just not good.

Let me start by saying the wait staff and hostess were VERY nice. The atmosphere was also nice. They are the reason I feel bad leaving a poor review.

The food was just the worst quality. Some cold, and some just not edible. The General tso's was ok, but that was about it. They did have a lot of options, don't get me wrong. However, none of them were good. I actually felt disappointed in myself after consuming this food.

My dad and I went because he had a 25% off coupon. The bill was still $19. They do not serve alcohol, so that was for the buffet and no drinks.

Last but not least, provide some guidance for the hibachi grill. That is what I wanted to eat, but I had NO clue how to go about getting it.
Was the most terrible buffet we ever went to !  Didnt even want to pay the bill..Hitachi grill was disgusting

Clean, better design and well furnished in comparison to the place before it.
However, the food quality took a pretty major dive. You want evidence? The crab rangoon, a Chinese staple, was about as bad as China Max is inside South Hills Village. 
The chicken and broccoli was a major disappointment.
If you want better Chinese food, go to the place in Bridgeville (good reviews on Yelp) or even the Grand China Buffet in downtown Washington, Pa.
This place is AWESOME! Lots of variety, friendly service, delicious food! Totally worth every dime! We will definitely be back!

So on our way back from Ruffsdale, we decided not to adopt the dog we had spent time with, but Kay wanted to stop by this Petsmart, one that competes in a tug-of-war with a nearby Petco (right down the road) for farts-n-chuckles. 

We walked out a Bret Michaels cat tunnel (yes, Poison's lead singer has a pet toy line out), some cat toys, a litter box, some cat litter, a water bowl, a food dish, and...a 7 month old Russian Blue kitten we renamed Dusty (his given name was Juan). 

And Kay once told me she hated cats.

We're now parents!
